GoalDescription: A strong and resilient nation in the face of climate change and disaster risks posed by natural and man-made hazards
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Strengthen post-disaster systems in planning, preparedness, response and recovery
IndicatorDescription: Percentage of climate change and disaster affected communities with durable solutions
ComputationMethod: (Number of climate change and disaster affected communities with durable solutions divided by total number climate change and disaster affected communities) x 100
Concept: Climate disasters occur when extreme climatic events interact with vulnerable social, economic and environmental conditions leading to severe alterations in normal functioning of a community or a society.
DataSource:
* Department of NDMO 
* Department of Environment 
* Department of Climate Change
* Vanuatu National Statistics Office
Definition: Climate Change and Natural Disasters. Many natural disasters are directly linked with the climate change including floods, hurricanes, tsunami, droughts, earthquake and La nina
Dissaggregation:
* Area Council Level
* Rural/Urban
* Provincial Level
* National Level
IndicatorShortName: Communities Affacted by Climate Change and Disasters with Durable Solutions
Rationale: Disasters affect large parts of the population, especially the poor and other marginalized groups. Between 1950 and 2011 disasters in the Pacific islands region affected approximately 4 million people, caused 8,693 reported deaths and resulted in damage costs of around US$3.2 billion. Tropical cyclones, the major cause of these losses and damage, are expected to increase in intensity, though not frequency, in most parts of the Pacific over the coming decades.
TargetDescription: 60% of climate change and disaster affected communities with durable solutions
